title: module 'torch.nn._functions.thnn' has no attribute 'batchnorm_double_backwards_fn'
body_html:
I installed PyTorch from source and did the following to remove the GOMP version error:

sudo rm /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/lib/libgomp.so.1
sudo ln -s /usr/lib/libgomp.so.1 /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/lib/libgomp.so.1

Now when I try to import torch, I get the following error:

IPython 6.1.0 -- An enhanced Interactive Python. Type '?' for help.
ln[1]: import torch
--------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
AttributeError: module 'torch.nn._functions.thnn' has no attribute 'batchnorm_double_backwards_fn'

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

SystemError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-c031d3dd82fc> in <module>()
----> 1 import torch
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/__init__.py in <module>()                                                                                                                                                                              
    332
    333 import torch.cuda
    --> 334 import torch.autograd
    335 import torch.nn
    336 import torch.optim  
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/autograd/__init__.py in <module>()
    42         tuple(variables), tuple(grad_variables), retain_variables)
    43
    ---> 44 assert torch._C._autograd_init()

I installed PyTorch from source and did the following to remove the GOMP version error:
sudo rm /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/lib/libgomp.so.1
sudo ln -s /usr/lib/libgomp.so.1 /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/lib/libgomp.so.1
Now when I try to import torch, I get the following error:

    ---> 44 assert torch._C._autograd_init()
body:
I installed PyTorch from source and did the following to remove the GOMP version error:

```bash
sudo rm /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/lib/libgomp.so.1
sudo ln -s /usr/lib/libgomp.so.1 /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/lib/libgomp.so.1
```

Now when I try to import torch, I get the following error:

```
IPython 6.1.0 -- An enhanced Interactive Python. Type '?' for help.
ln[1]: import torch
--------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
AttributeError: module 'torch.nn._functions.thnn' has no attribute 'batchnorm_double_backwards_fn'

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

SystemError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-c031d3dd82fc> in <module>()
----> 1 import torch
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/__init__.py in <module>()                                                                                                                                                                              
    332
    333 import torch.cuda
    --> 334 import torch.autograd
    335 import torch.nn
    336 import torch.optim  
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/autograd/__init__.py in <module>()
    42         tuple(variables), tuple(grad_variables), retain_variables)
    43
    ---> 44 assert torch._C._autograd_init()
```
